---
title: "package.json"
---

## High-level description
This is a `package.json` file for the `ieee754` npm package. It provides functionality to read and write IEEE 754 floating-point numbers from/to a Buffer or array-like object. The package is authored by Feross Aboukhadijeh and is licensed under the BSD-3-Clause license.

## Symbols

### Package Information
#### Description
The package is named "ieee754" and is currently at version 1.2.1. It is designed to handle IEEE 754 floating-point numbers, specifically for reading from and writing to Buffer or array-like objects.

### Author and Contributors
#### Description
The main author is Feross Aboukhadijeh, with one contributor listed: Romain Beauxis.

### Dependencies
#### Description
The package has no runtime dependencies, but it does have several development dependencies:

| Dependency | Purpose |
|:-----------|:--------|
| airtap | Used for browser testing |
| standard | Likely used for code linting and style checking |
| tape | Used for running tests |

### Main File and Types
#### Description
The main entry point for the package is `index.js`, and TypeScript type definitions are provided in `index.d.ts`.

### Scripts
#### Description
The package defines several npm scripts for testing:

| Script | Description |
|:-------|:------------|
| test | Runs the standard linter, node tests, and browser tests |
| test-browser | Runs browser tests using airtap |
| test-browser-local | Runs browser tests locally using airtap |
| test-node | Runs node tests using tape |

### Repository
#### Description
The source code is hosted on GitHub at `git://github.com/feross/ieee754.git`.

### Funding
#### Description
The package author provides multiple funding options for supporters:

1. GitHub Sponsors
2. Patreon
3. Consulting services

## Keywords
The package is associated with the following keywords: IEEE 754, buffer, convert, floating point, ieee754.

## License
The package is licensed under the BSD-3-Clause license.

This `package.json` file provides essential metadata about the `ieee754` package, including its purpose, author information, dependencies, scripts for development and testing, and funding options. It's a crucial file for npm to understand how to handle the package and for developers to quickly grasp its basic information and usage.
